unnormalised: Namaste readers! In a big win for sustainability, Rajasthan is seeing a surge in renewable energy projects. Dr. Sharma from IIT-Delhi says solar power generation has increased by 25% in the last quarter, partially thanks to innovative new designs implemented in Bhadla Solar Park, a whopping 14,000 acres or 609,840,000 sq ft. area.
normalised: Namaste readers! In a big win for sustainability, Rajasthan is seeing a surge in renewable energy projects. Doctor Sharma from I I T-Delhi says solar power generation has increased by twenty five percent in the last quarter, partially thanks to innovative new designs implemented in Bhadla Solar Park, a whopping fourteen thousand acres or six hundred nine million eight hundred and forty thousand square feet area.

unnormalised: The state government announced further incentives, offering subsidies of up to Rs. 5 lakhs for rural households installing solar panels. This initiative aims to power remote villages and reduce reliance on traditional fossil fuels. Even Amrita Devi Bishnoi University is now running entirely on solar power. Looking ahead, the government plans to build new wind farms across 500 km of coastline. Fingers crossed this leads to a greener and cleaner future for Bharat! Let's keep supporting these efforts.
normalised: The state government announced further incentives, offering subsidies of up to rupee five lakhs for rural households installing solar panels. This initiative aims to power remote villages and reduce reliance on traditional fossil fuels. Even Amrita Devi Bishnoi University is now running entirely on solar power. Looking ahead, the government plans to build new wind farms across five hundred kilometer of coastline. Fingers crossed this leads to a greener and cleaner future for Bharat! Let's keep supporting these efforts.
